title: On the Stable Birationality of Hilbert schemes of points on surfaces
abstract:
The aim of this paper is to study the stable birational type of $Hilb^n_X$,
the Hilbert scheme of degree $n$ points on a surface $X$. More precisely, it
addresses the question for which pairs of positive integers $(n,n')$ the
variety $Hilb^n_X$ is stably birational to $Hilb^{n'}_X$, when $X$ is a surface
with irregularity $q(X)=0$. After general results for such surfaces, we
restrict our attention to geometrically rational surfaces, proving that there
are only finitely many stable birational classes among the $Hilb^n_X$'s. As a
corollary, we deduce the rationality of the motivic zeta function $\zeta(X,t)$
in $K_0(Var/k)/([\mathbb{A}^1_k])[[t]]$ over fields of characteristic zero.
